intro: Schizoglossum euphorbioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, and it produces a toxic latex that can cause skin irritation. Schizoglossum euphorbioides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
